D. Arduino USB MITM Code

cpp
// arduino_mitm.ino - USB Man-in-the-Middle for G902 Mouse
#include <Keyboard.h>
#include <Mouse.h>
#include <SoftwareSerial.h>

// Configuration
#define RPI_RX 2
#define RPI_TX 3
#define TRIGGER_PIN 4
#define STEALTH_PIN 5

SoftwareSerial rpiSerial(RPI_RX, RPI_TX); // Communication with Raspberry Pi

// Game state variables
struct GameState {
  int enemy_x;
  int enemy_y;
  int enemy_health;
  bool enemy_visible;
  bool trigger_active;
};

GameState current_state;
unsigned long last_update = 0;
bool stealth_mode = false;

void setup() {
  // Initialize serial communications
  Serial.begin(115200);  // Computer communication
  rpiSerial.begin(115200); // Raspberry Pi communication
  
  // Initialize HID
  Keyboard.begin();
  Mouse.begin();
  
  // Setup pins
  pinMode(TRIGGER_PIN, OUTPUT);
  pinMode(STEALTH_PIN, INPUT_PULLUP);
  
  // Initial state
  current_state.trigger_active = false;
  stealth_mode = digitalRead(STEALTH_PIN) == LOW;
  
  delay(1000); // Initial stabilization
}

void loop() {
  // Check stealth mode
  stealth_mode = digitalRead(STEALTH_PIN) == LOW;
  
  // Read from Raspberry Pi
  if (rpiSerial.available() > 0) {
    process_rpi_command(rpiSerial.readStringUntil('\n'));
  }
  
  // Read from computer (spoofed mouse data)
  if (Serial.available() > 0) {
    process_computer_data(Serial.readStringUntil('\n'));
  }
  
  // Execute game logic
  execute_game_logic();
  
  // Send status updates
  if (millis() - last_update > 100) { // 10Hz updates
    send_status_update();
    last_update = millis();
  }
}

void process_rpi_command(String command) {
  // Commands from Raspberry Pi (encrypted game data)
  if (command.startsWith("GAMEDATA:")) {
    String data = command.substring(9);
    parse_game_data(data);
  } 
  else if (command.startsWith("TRIGGER:")) {
    // Triggerbot command
    String params = command.substring(8);
    execute_triggerbot(params);
  }
  else if (command.startsWith("CONFIG:")) {
    // Configuration update
    update_config(command.substring(7));
  }
}

void process_computer_data(String data) {
  // Data from computer (legitimate mouse movements)
  // We can modify or spoof this data
  if (stealth_mode) {
    // In stealth mode, pass through legitimate data
    send_to_rpi("MOUSE:" + data);
  } else {
    // Apply modifications for aim assistance
    String modified_data = apply_aim_correction(data);
    send_to_rpi("MOUSE:" + modified_data);
  }
}

void parse_game_data(String data) {
  // Parse encrypted game data from RPi
  // Format: "x,y,health,visible"
  int first_comma = data.indexOf(',');
  int second_comma = data.indexOf(',', first_comma + 1);
  int third_comma = data.indexOf(',', second_comma + 1);
  
  if (first_comma != -1 && second_comma != -1 && third_comma != -1) {
    current_state.enemy_x = data.substring(0, first_comma).toInt();
    current_state.enemy_y = data.substring(first_comma + 1, second_comma).toInt();
    current_state.enemy_health = data.substring(second_comma + 1, third_comma).toInt();
    current_state.enemy_visible = data.substring(third_comma + 1).toInt() == 1;
  }
}

void execute_game_logic() {
  if (!current_state.enemy_visible || current_state.enemy_health <= 0) {
    if (current_state.trigger_active) {
      release_trigger();
    }
    return;
  }
  
  // Calculate if enemy is in crosshair
  bool in_crosshair = check_crosshair_position();
  
  if (in_crosshair && !current_state.trigger_active) {
    pull_trigger();
  } else if (!in_crosshair && current_state.trigger_active) {
    release_trigger();
  }
}

bool check_crosshair_position() {
  // Simple crosshair check - in real implementation, this would use
  // actual game data for precise positioning
  int crosshair_x = 960; // Center of 1920x1080 screen
  int crosshair_y = 540;
  
  int tolerance = 50; // Pixel tolerance for trigger
  
  return abs(current_state.enemy_x - crosshair_x) < tolerance && 
         abs(current_state.enemy_y - crosshair_y) < tolerance;
}

void execute_triggerbot(String params) {
  // Direct triggerbot command from RPi
  if (params == "ON") {
    pull_trigger();
  } else if (params == "OFF") {
    release_trigger();
  } else if (params.startsWith("AUTO")) {
    // Automatic triggerbot based on game state
    // Already handled in execute_game_logic
  }
}

void pull_trigger() {
  if (!current_state.trigger_active) {
    Mouse.press(MOUSE_LEFT);
    current_state.trigger_active = true;
    send_to_rpi("TRIGGER:ACTIVE");
    
    // Add random delay for human-like behavior
    delay(random(10, 25));
  }
}

void release_trigger() {
  if (current_state.trigger_active) {
    Mouse.release(MOUSE_LEFT);
    current_state.trigger_active = false;
    send_to_rpi("TRIGGER:INACTIVE");
  }
}

String apply_aim_correction(String original_data) {
  // Apply subtle aim correction for legit-looking assistance
  if (!current_state.enemy_visible) {
    return original_data;
  }
  
  // Parse original mouse data
  int comma_pos = original_data.indexOf(',');
  if (comma_pos == -1) return original_data;
  
  int delta_x = original_data.substring(0, comma_pos).toInt();
  int delta_y = original_data.substring(comma_pos + 1).toInt();
  
  // Calculate aim correction (subtle)
  int aim_correction_x = 0;
  int aim_correction_y = 0;
  
  if (abs(current_state.enemy_x - 960) < 200) {
    aim_correction_x = (current_state.enemy_x - 960) / 100;
  }
  
  if (abs(current_state.enemy_y - 540) < 200) {
    aim_correction_y = (current_state.enemy_y - 540) / 100;
  }
  
  // Apply correction with randomness for human-like behavior
  delta_x += aim_correction_x + random(-2, 3);
  delta_y += aim_correction_y + random(-2, 3);
  
  return String(delta_x) + "," + String(delta_y);
}

void update_config(String config) {
  // Update configuration from RPi
  if (config.startsWith("STEALTH:")) {
    stealth_mode = config.substring(8) == "ON";
    digitalWrite(STEALTH_PIN, stealth_mode ? HIGH : LOW);
  }
}

void send_status_update() {
  // Send status to Raspberry Pi
  String status = "STATUS:" + 
                  String(current_state.trigger_active ? "ACTIVE" : "INACTIVE") + "," +
                  String(stealth_mode ? "STEALTH" : "NORMAL") + "," +
                  String(current_state.enemy_visible ? "VISIBLE" : "HIDDEN");
  
  send_to_rpi(status);
}

void send_to_rpi(String data) {
  rpiSerial.println(data);
}

// Emergency cleanup function
void emergency_stop() {
  Mouse.release(MOUSE_LEFT);
  Mouse.release(MOUSE_RIGHT);
  Keyboard.releaseAll();
  current_state.trigger_active = false;
  
  // Send emergency stop to RPi
  send_to_rpi("EMERGENCY:STOP");
  
  while(true) {
    // Wait for reset
    delay(1000);
  }
}

E. Raspberry Pi Network Bridge

python
#!/usr/bin/env python3
# rpi_bridge.py - Raspberry Pi Network Bridge
import socket
import serial
import threading
import time
import json
import hashlib
from cryptography.fernet import Fernet

class RPiBridge:
    def __init__(self):
        self.config = {
            'vps_ip': 'your-vps-domain.com',
            'vps_port': 443,
            'arduino_port': '/dev/ttyACM0',
            'baud_rate': 115200,
            'encryption_key': b'your-encryption-key-here-32-bytes=',
            'stealth_mode': True
        }
        
        self.connected = False
        self.game_data = {}
        self.arduino = None
        self.vps_socket = None
        self.cipher = Fernet(self.config['encryption_key'])
        
    def initialize(self):
        print("[RPi] Initializing Raspberry Pi bridge...")
        
        try:
            # Initialize Arduino connection
            self.arduino = serial.Serial(
                self.config['arduino_port'],
                self.config['baud_rate'],
                timeout=1
            )
            print("[RPi] Arduino connected")
            
            # Initialize VPS connection
            self.connect_to_vps()
            
            # Start communication threads
            self.start_threads()
            
            self.connected = True
            print("[RPi] Bridge initialized successfully")
            return True
            
        except Exception as e:
            print(f"[RPi] Initialization failed: {e}")
            return False
    
    def connect_to_vps(self):
        try:
            self.vps_socket = socket.socket(socket.AF_INET, socket.SOCK_STREAM)
            self.vps_socket.connect((self.config['vps_ip'], self.config['vps_port']))
            print("[RPi] Connected to VPS")
        except Exception as e:
            print(f"[RPi] VPS connection failed: {e}")
    
    def start_threads(self):
        # Arduino to VPS thread
        arduino_thread = threading.Thread(target=self.arduino_to_vps_loop)
        arduino_thread.daemon = True
        arduino_thread.start()
        
        # VPS to Arduino thread  
        vps_thread = threading.Thread(target=self.vps_to_arduino_loop)
        vps_thread.daemon = True
        vps_thread.start()
        
        # Heartbeat thread
        heartbeat_thread = threading.Thread(target=self.heartbeat_loop)
        heartbeat_thread.daemon = True
        heartbeat_thread.start()
    
    def arduino_to_vps_loop(self):
        while True:
            try:
                if self.arduino and self.arduino.in_waiting > 0:
                    data = self.arduino.readline().decode('utf-8').strip()
                    if data:
                        self.process_arduino_data(data)
                        
            except Exception as e:
                print(f"[RPi] Arduino read error: {e}")
                time.sleep(1)
    
    def vps_to_arduino_loop(self):
        while True:
            try:
                if self.vps_socket:
                    data = self.vps_socket.recv(4096)
                    if data:
                        self.process_vps_data(data)
                        
            except Exception as e:
                print(f"[RPi] VPS read error: {e}")
                self.reconnect_vps()
    
    def heartbeat_loop(self):
        while True:
            try:
                if self.connected:
                    # Send heartbeat to VPS
                    heartbeat = {
                        'type': 'heartbeat',
                        'timestamp': time.time(),
                        'status': 'active'
                    }
                    self.send_to_vps(heartbeat)
                    
                    # Send status request to Arduino
                    if self.arduino:
                        self.arduino.write(b"STATUS_REQUEST\n")
                
                time.sleep(5)  # 5 second heartbeat
                
            except Exception as e:
                print(f"[RPi] Heartbeat error: {e}")
    
    def process_arduino_data(self, data):
        try:
            if data.startswith('GAMEDATA:'):
                # Game data from Windows machine via Arduino
                game_data = data[9:]
                encrypted_data = self.encrypt_data(game_data)
                
                packet = {
                    'type': 'game_data',
                    'data': encrypted_data,
                    'timestamp': time.time()
                }
                self.send_to_vps(packet)
                
            elif data.startswith('STATUS:'):
                # Status update from Arduino
                status_data = data[7:]
                self.update_status(status_data)
                
            elif data.startswith('TRIGGER:'):
                # Triggerbot status
                trigger_data = data[8:]
                print(f"[RPi] Triggerbot: {trigger_data}")
                
            elif data == 'EMERGENCY:STOP':
                print("[RPi] EMERGENCY STOP RECEIVED")
                self.emergency_stop()
                
        except Exception as e:
            print(f"[RPi] Arduino data processing error: {e}")
    
    def process_vps_data(self, data):
        try:
            packet = json.loads(data.decode('utf-8'))
            
            if packet['type'] == 'radar_data':
                # Process radar data from VPS
                self.process_radar_data(packet['data'])
                
            elif packet['type'] == 'trigger_command':
                # Triggerbot command from VPS
                self.send_to_arduino(f"TRIGGER:{packet['command']}")
                
            elif packet['type'] == 'config_update':
                # Configuration update
                self.update_config(packet['config'])
                
        except Exception as e:
            print(f"[RPi] VPS data processing error: {e}")
    
    def process_radar_data(self, radar_data):
        try:
            # Decrypt and process radar data
            decrypted_data = self.decrypt_data(radar_data)
            game_state = json.loads(decrypted_data)
            
            # Extract enemy information for triggerbot
            enemies = []
            for player in game_state.get('players', []):
                if player.get('team') != 2:  # Assuming team 2 is our team
                    enemy = {
                        'x': player.get('x', 0),
                        'y': player.get('y', 0),
                        'health': player.get('health', 100),
                        'visible': player.get('spotted', False)
                    }
                    enemies.append(enemy)
            
            # Send enemy data to Arduino
            if enemies:
                primary_enemy = enemies[0]  # Closest/best target
                enemy_data = f"{primary_enemy['x']},{primary_enemy['y']},{primary_enemy['health']},{1 if primary_enemy['visible'] else 0}"
                self.send_to_arduino(f"GAMEDATA:{enemy_data}")
                
        except Exception as e:
            print(f"[RPi] Radar data processing error: {e}")
    
    def send_to_vps(self, data):
        try:
            if self.vps_socket:
                json_data = json.dumps(data)
                self.vps_socket.send(json_data.encode('utf-8'))
        except Exception as e:
            print(f"[RPi] VPS send error: {e}")
            self.reconnect_vps()
    
    def send_to_arduino(self, data):
        try:
            if self.arduino:
                self.arduino.write(f"{data}\n".encode('utf-8'))
        except Exception as e:
            print(f"[RPi] Arduino send error: {e}")
    
    def encrypt_data(self, data):
        return self.cipher.encrypt(data.encode('utf-8')).decode('utf-8')
    
    def decrypt_data(self, encrypted_data):
        return self.cipher.decrypt(encrypted_data.encode('utf-8')).decode('utf-8')
    
    def update_status(self, status_data):
        # Update internal status
        parts = status_data.split(',')
        if len(parts) >= 3:
            print(f"[RPi] Status - Trigger: {parts[0]}, Mode: {parts[1]}, Visibility: {parts[2]}")
    
    def update_config(self, new_config):
        self.config.update(new_config)
        print(f"[RPi] Config updated: {new_config}")
        
        # Send config to Arduino
        if 'stealth_mode' in new_config:
            stealth_cmd = "STEALTH:ON" if new_config['stealth_mode'] else "STEALTH:OFF"
            self.send_to_arduino(f"CONFIG:{stealth_cmd}")
    
    def reconnect_vps(self):
        print("[RPi] Attempting to reconnect to VPS...")
        time.sleep(5)
        self.connect_to_vps()
    
    def emergency_stop(self):
        print("[RPi] Executing emergency stop procedure...")
        
        # Send stop commands
        self.send_to_arduino("TRIGGER:OFF")
        self.send_to_arduino("CONFIG:STEALTH:ON")
        
        # Close connections
        if self.arduino:
            self.arduino.close()
        if self.vps_socket:
            self.vps_socket.close()
        
        self.connected = False
        
    def run(self):
        if self.initialize():
            try:
                while True:
                    time.sleep(1)
            except KeyboardInterrupt:
                print("[RPi] Shutting down...")
                self.emergency_stop()
        else:
            print("[RPi] Failed to initialize bridge")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    bridge = RPiBridge()
    bridge.run()

🌐 PART 5: Advanced VPS & Web Radar System

F. Enhanced Cloud Radar Server

javascript
// advanced_cloud_server.js
const express = require('express');
const WebSocket = require('ws');
const https = require('https');
const fs = require('fs');
const crypto = require('crypto');
const NodeCache = require('node-cache');

class AdvancedCloudRadar {
    constructor() {
        this.app = express();
        this.port = 443;
        this.clients = new Set();
        this.hardwareBridges = new Map();
        this.offsetCache = new NodeCache({ stdTTL: 300 });
        
        this.radarData = {
            players: [],
            map: 'de_dust2',
            timestamp: Date.now(),
            sequence: 0
        };

        this.obfuscationEngine = new AdvancedObfuscationEngine();
        this.offsetProvider = new SmartOffsetProvider();
        this.triggerbotManager = new TriggerbotManager();
        
        this.setupServer();
        this.setupRoutes();
        this.startSecurityServices();
    }

    setupServer() {
        const sslOptions = {
            key: fs.readFileSync('./ssl/private.key'),
            cert: fs.readFileSync('./ssl/certificate.crt'),
            passphrase: process.env.SSL_PASSPHRASE || 'academic2024',
            secureProtocol: 'TLSv1_2_method',
            ciphers: [
                'ECDHE-RSA-AES128-GCM-SHA256',
                'ECDHE-RSA-AES256-GCM-SHA384'
            ].join(':'),
            honorCipherOrder: true
        };

        this.server = https.createServer(sslOptions, this.app);
        
        this.wss = new WebSocket.Server({ 
            server: this.server,
            verifyClient: this.verifyClient.bind(this),
            perMessageDeflate: false
        });
        
        this.wss.on('connection', this.handleConnection.bind(this));
    }

    setupRoutes() {
        // Serve legitimate-looking content
        this.app.use(express.static('public', {
            setHeaders: (res, path) => {
                res.setHeader('X-Content-Type-Options', 'nosniff');
                res.setHeader('X-Frame-Options', 'DENY');
                res.setHeader('X-XSS-Protection', '1; mode=block');
                res.setHeader('Strict-Transport-Security', 'max-age=31536000');
            }
        }));

        // Game data endpoint
        this.app.post('/api/game/telemetry', 
            express.raw({ type: 'application/octet-stream', limit: '10mb' }),
            this.handleGameData.bind(this)
        );

        // Hardware bridge registration
        this.app.post('/api/bridge/register', 
            express.json(),
            this.handleBridgeRegistration.bind(this)
        );

        // Offset provider
        this.app.get('/api/offsets/verified', this.handleOffsetRequest.bind(this));
        
        // Fake analytics API
        this.app.get('/api/analytics', (req, res) => {
            res.json(this.generateFakeAnalytics());
        });

        // Health check
        this.app.get('/health', (req, res) => {
            res.json({ 
                status: 'healthy', 
                service: 'game_analytics_dashboard',
                uptime: process.uptime(),
                connected_clients: this.clients.size,
                connected_bridges: this.hardwareBridges.size
            });
        });
    }

    async handleGameData(req, res) {
        try {
            const clientIP = req.headers['x-forwarded-for'] || req.socket.remoteAddress;
            
            if (!this.checkRateLimit(clientIP)) {
                return res.status(429).json({ error: 'Rate limit exceeded' });
            }

            const decryptedData = await this.obfuscationEngine.decryptAndValidate(req.body);
            if (!decryptedData) {
                return res.status(400).json({ error: 'Invalid data' });
            }

            this.processGameData(decryptedData);
            
            const response = this.obfuscationEngine.obfuscateResponse({ 
                status: 'success', 
                processed: Date.now() 
            });
            
            res.setHeader('Content-Type', 'application/octet-stream');
            res.send(response);

        } catch (error) {
            console.error('Game data processing error:', error);
            res.status(500).json({ error: 'Internal server error' });
        }
    }

    async handleBridgeRegistration(req, res) {
        try {
            const { bridge_id, public_key, capabilities } = req.body;
            
            if (!this.validateBridgeRegistration(bridge_id, public_key)) {
                return res.status(403).json({ error: 'Invalid registration' });
            }

            this.hardwareBridges.set(bridge_id, {
                id: bridge_id,
                public_key: public_key,
                capabilities: capabilities,
                last_seen: Date.now(),
                ip_address: req.ip
            });

            const session_key = this.obfuscationEngine.generateSessionKey();
            
            res.json({
                status: 'registered',
                session_key: session_key,
                update_interval: 50,
                max_players: 64
            });

        } catch (error) {
            console.error('Bridge registration error:', error);
            res.status(500).json({ error: 'Registration failed' });
        }
    }

    async handleOffsetRequest(req, res) {
        try {
            const clientHash = req.headers['x-client-hash'];
            const gameVersion = req.headers['x-game-version'] || 'latest';
            
            if (!this.validateClientHash(clientHash)) {
                return res.status(403).json({ error: 'Unauthorized' });
            }

            let offsets = this.offsetCache.get(gameVersion);
            if (!offsets) {
                offsets = await this.offsetProvider.getVerifiedOffsets(gameVersion);
                if (offsets) {
                    this.offsetCache.set(gameVersion, offsets);
                }
            }

            if (!offsets) {
                return res.status(404).json({ error: 'Offsets not available' });
            }

            const obfuscatedOffsets = this.obfuscationEngine.obfuscateOffsets(offsets);
            res.json(obfuscatedOffsets);

        } catch (error) {
            console.error('Offset request error:', error);
            res.status(500).json({ error: 'Internal server error' });
        }
    }

    processGameData(data) {
        if (!data.players || !Array.isArray(data.players)) {
            throw new Error('Invalid player data format');
        }

        // Sanitize and process player data
        const sanitizedPlayers = data.players
            .slice(0, 64)
            .map(player => this.sanitizePlayerData(player))
            .filter(player => player.health > 0 && !player.dormant);

        // Update radar data
        this.radarData = {
            players: sanitizedPlayers,
            map: data.map || this.radarData.map,
            timestamp: Date.now(),
            sequence: this.radarData.sequence + 1
        };

        // Run triggerbot logic
        this.triggerbotManager.processGameState(this.radarData);
        
        // Send commands to hardware bridges
        this.sendToHardwareBridges();

        // Broadcast to web clients
        this.broadcastToClients();
    }

    sanitizePlayerData(player) {
        return {
            x: this.clampValue(Number(player.x) || 0, -10000, 10000),
            y: this.clampValue(Number(player.y) || 0, -10000, 10000),
            z: this.clampValue(Number(player.z) || 0, -1000, 1000),
            health: this.clampValue(Math.max(0, Number(player.health) || 0), 0, 100),
            team: Number(player.team) || 0,
            name: String(player.name || 'Player').substring(0, 32).replace(/[^\w\s]/gi, ''),
            armor: this.clampValue(Math.max(0, Number(player.armor) || 0), 0, 100),
            weapon_id: Number(player.weapon_id) || 0,
            spotted: Boolean(player.spotted),
            dormant: Boolean(player.dormant),
            scoped: Boolean(player.scoped),
            crouching: Boolean(player.crouching),
            money: this.clampValue(Number(player.money) || 0, 0, 16000)
        };
    }

    clampValue(value, min, max) {
        return Math.min(Math.max(value, min), max);
    }

    sendToHardwareBridges() {
        if (this.hardwareBridges.size === 0) return;

        const gameState = {
            type: 'game_state',
            data: this.radarData,
            timestamp: Date.now()
        };

        const encryptedState = this.obfuscationEngine.encryptMessage(gameState);

        this.hardwareBridges.forEach((bridge, bridgeId) => {
            if (Date.now() - bridge.last_seen < 30000) { // 30 second timeout
                this.sendToBridge(bridgeId, encryptedState);
            } else {
                // Remove stale bridges
                this.hardwareBridges.delete(bridgeId);
            }
        });
    }

    sendToBridge(bridgeId, message) {
        // In production, this would send via WebSocket or other transport
        // to the specific hardware bridge
        console.log(`[VPS] Sending to bridge ${bridgeId}: ${message.length} bytes`);
    }

    broadcastToClients() {
        if (this.clients.size === 0) return;

        const message = {
            type: 'radar_update',
            data: this.radarData,
            timestamp: Date.now(),
            sequence: this.radarData.sequence
        };

        const obfuscatedMessage = this.obfuscationEngine.obfuscateMessage(message);
        const messageString = JSON.stringify(obfuscatedMessage);

        this.clients.forEach(client => {
            if (client.readyState === WebSocket.OPEN) {
                client.send(messageString);
            }
        });
    }

    verifyClient(info) {
        try {
            const token = new URL(info.req.url, 'http://localhost').searchParams.get('token');
            const clientHash = info.req.headers['x-client-hash'];
            
            return this.obfuscationEngine.validateConnectionToken(token) && 
                   this.validateClientHash(clientHash);
        } catch {
            return false;
        }
    }

    validateClientHash(clientHash) {
        if (!clientHash) return false;
        
        try {
            const decoded = Buffer.from(clientHash, 'base64').toString();
            const data = JSON.parse(decoded);
            
            const isExpired = Date.now() - data.timestamp > 300000; // 5 minutes
            const isValid = data.signature === this.generateClientSignature(data);
            
            return !isExpired && isValid;
        } catch {
            return false;
        }
    }

    validateBridgeRegistration(bridgeId, publicKey) {
        // Validate bridge registration
        return bridgeId && publicKey && bridgeId.length === 32;
    }

    generateClientSignature(data) {
        const secret = process.env.CLIENT_SECRET || 'vectorized_stealth_2024';
        const str = `${data.timestamp}${data.session}${data.nonce}${secret}`;
        return crypto.createHash('sha256').update(str).digest('hex');
    }

    generateFakeAnalytics() {
        return {
            active_users: Math.floor(Math.random() * 500) + 100,
            page_views: Math.floor(Math.random() * 10000) + 5000,
            bounce_rate: (Math.random() * 0.3 + 0.4).toFixed(2),
            avg_session_duration: Math.floor(Math.random() * 300) + 60,
            timestamp: Date.now()
        };
    }

    checkRateLimit(clientIP) {
        // Simple rate limiting - in production, use Redis
        return true;
    }

    handleConnection(ws, req) {
        console.log('New radar client connected:', req.socket.remoteAddress);
        
        this.clients.add(ws);

        const sessionConfig = {
            type: 'config',
            session: this.obfuscationEngine.generateSessionKey(),
            update_rate: 50,
            max_players: 64,
            timestamp: Date.now()
        };

        ws.send(JSON.stringify(sessionConfig));

        ws.on('message', (data) => {
            this.handleClientMessage(ws, data);
        });

        ws.on('close', () => {
            this.clients.delete(ws);
            console.log('Radar client disconnected');
        });

        ws.on('error', (error) => {
            console.error('WebSocket error:', error);
            this.clients.delete(ws);
        });
    }

    handleClientMessage(ws, data) {
        try {
            const message = this.obfuscationEngine.decryptMessage(data.toString());
            
            switch (message.type) {
                case 'ping':
                    this.handlePing(ws, message);
                    break;
                case 'map_change':
                    this.handleMapChange(ws, message);
                    break;
                case 'config_update':
                    this.handleConfigUpdate(ws, message);
                    break;
                default:
                    console.log('Unknown message type:', message.type);
            }
        } catch (error) {
            console.error('Message processing error:', error);
        }
    }

    handlePing(ws, message) {
        const response = {
            type: 'pong',
            timestamp: Date.now(),
            server_time: Date.now()
        };
        ws.send(JSON.stringify(response));
    }

    handleMapChange(ws, message) {
        this.radarData.map = message.map;
        this.broadcastToClients();
    }

    handleConfigUpdate(ws, message) {
        // Update configuration based on client request
        console.log('Config update:', message.config);
    }

    startSecurityServices() {
        // Rotate encryption keys every hour
        setInterval(() => {
            this.obfuscationEngine.rotateKeys();
        }, 3600000);

        // Clean up stale data
        setInterval(() => {
            this.cleanupStaleData();
        }, 30000);

        // Update offsets cache
        setInterval(() => {
            this.updateOffsetsCache();
        }, 300000);

        // Security audit log
        setInterval(() => {
            this.securityAudit();
        }, 60000);
    }

    cleanupStaleData() {
        const now = Date.now();
        if (now - this.radarData.timestamp > 30000) {
            this.radarData.players = [];
        }

        // Clean up stale hardware bridges
        this.hardwareBridges.forEach((bridge, bridgeId) => {
            if (now - bridge.last_seen > 30000) {
                this.hardwareBridges.delete(bridgeId);
            }
        });
    }

    async updateOffsetsCache() {
        try {
            const offsets = await this.offsetProvider.getLatestOffsets();
            if (offsets) {
                this.offsetCache.set('latest', offsets);
                console.log('Offsets cache updated');
            }
        } catch (error) {
            console.error('Failed to update offsets cache:', error);
        }
    }

    securityAudit() {
        const audit = {
            timestamp: Date.now(),
            connected_clients: this.clients.size,
            connected_bridges: this.hardwareBridges.size,
            memory_usage: process.memoryUsage(),
            uptime: process.uptime()
        };
        
        console.log('Security audit:', audit);
    }

    start() {
        this.server.listen(this.port, () => {
            console.log(`Advanced Cloud Radar Server running on port ${this.port}`);
            console.log('Traffic mimicking: ENABLED');
            console.log('Obfuscation: ENABLED');
            console.log('Auto-offsets: ENABLED');
            console.log('Triggerbot management: ENABLED');
        });
    }
}

class AdvancedObfuscationEngine {
    constructor() {
        this.encryptionKey = crypto.randomBytes(32);
        this.hmacKey = crypto.randomBytes(32);
        this.rotationInterval = 3600000;
        this.lastRotation = Date.now();
    }

    async decryptAndValidate(encryptedData) {
        try {
            const decrypted = this.decryptData(encryptedData);
            const data = JSON.parse(decrypted);

            if (!this.validateHMAC(data)) {
                return null;
            }

            if (Date.now() - data.timestamp > 10000) {
                return null;
            }

            return data.payload;

        } catch (error) {
            console.error('Decryption/validation error:', error);
            return null;
        }
    }

    decryptData(encryptedData) {
        const algorithm = 'aes-256-gcm';
        const parts = encryptedData.toString().split(':');
        
        if (parts.length !== 3) throw new Error('Invalid encrypted data format');
        
        const iv = Buffer.from(parts[0], 'hex');
        const authTag = Buffer.from(parts[1], 'hex');
        const encrypted = Buffer.from(parts[2], 'hex');

        const decipher = crypto.createDecipheriv(algorithm, this.encryptionKey, iv);
        decipher.setAuthTag(authTag);

        let decrypted = decipher.update(encrypted, 'hex', 'utf8');
        decrypted += decipher.final('utf8');

        return decrypted;
    }

    validateHMAC(data) {
        const expectedHmac = data.hmac;
        delete data.hmac;

        const message = JSON.stringify(data);
        const actualHmac = crypto.createHmac('sha256', this.hmacKey)
            .update(message)
            .digest('hex');

        return crypto.timingSafeEqual(
            Buffer.from(expectedHmac, 'hex'),
            Buffer.from(actualHmac, 'hex')
        );
    }

    obfuscateResponse(data) {
        const payload = {
            data: data,
            timestamp: Date.now(),
            nonce: crypto.randomBytes(16).toString('hex')
        };

        payload.hmac = crypto.createHmac('sha256', this.hmacKey)
            .update(JSON.stringify(payload))
            .digest('hex');

        return this.encryptData(JSON.stringify(payload));
    }

    encryptData(data) {
        const algorithm = 'aes-256-gcm';
        const iv = crypto.randomBytes(16);

        const cipher = crypto.createCipheriv(algorithm, this.encryptionKey, iv);
        
        let encrypted = cipher.update(data, 'utf8', 'hex');
        encrypted += cipher.final('hex');

        const authTag = cipher.getAuthTag();

        return Buffer.from(iv.toString('hex') + ':' + authTag.toString('hex') + ':' + encrypted);
    }

    obfuscateMessage(message) {
        // Add noise and transform message
        return {
            ...message,
            noise: crypto.randomBytes(8).toString('hex'),
            checksum: this.generateChecksum(message),
            obfuscated: true
        };
    }

    obfuscateOffsets(offsets) {
        // Obfuscate memory offsets
        const obfuscated = { ...offsets };
        obfuscated.timestamp = Date.now();
        obfuscated.signature = this.generateOffsetSignature(offsets);
        return obfuscated;
    }

    generateOffsetSignature(offsets) {
        const str = JSON.stringify(offsets) + this.hmacKey.toString('hex');
        return crypto.createHash('sha256').update(str).digest('hex');
    }

    generateChecksum(message) {
        const str = JSON.stringify(message);
        return crypto.createHash('md5').update(str).digest('hex');
    }

    rotateKeys() {
        this.encryptionKey = crypto.randomBytes(32);
        this.hmacKey = crypto.randomBytes(32);
        this.lastRotation = Date.now();
        console.log('Encryption keys rotated');
    }

    generateSessionKey() {
        return {
            key: crypto.randomBytes(16).toString('hex'),
            expires: Date.now() + this.rotationInterval,
            algorithm: 'aes-256-gcm'
        };
    }

    validateConnectionToken(token) {
        try {
            const decoded = Buffer.from(token, 'base64').toString();
            const data = JSON.parse(decoded);

            const isExpired = Date.now() > data.expires;
            const isValid = data.signature === this.generateTokenSignature(data);

            return !isExpired && isValid;
        } catch {
            return false;
        }
    }

    generateTokenSignature(data) {
        const str = `${data.timestamp}${data.session}${data.nonce}`;
        return crypto.createHmac('sha256', this.hmacKey)
            .update(str)
            .digest('hex');
    }

    encryptMessage(message) {
        return this.encryptData(JSON.stringify(message));
    }

    decryptMessage(encryptedMessage) {
        const decrypted = this.decryptData(encryptedMessage);
        return JSON.parse(decrypted);
    }
}

class SmartOffsetProvider {
    constructor() {
        this.sources = [
            'https://raw.githubusercontent.com/a2x/cs2-dumper/main/output/offsets.json',
            'https://api.github.com/repos/a2x/cs2-dumper/contents/output/offsets.json'
        ];
        this.cache = new NodeCache({ stdTTL: 600 });
    }

    async getVerifiedOffsets(version = 'latest') {
        const cached = this.cache.get(version);
        if (cached) return cached;

        for (const source of this.sources) {
            try {
                const offsets = await this.fetchFromSource(source);
                if (offsets && this.validateOffsets(offsets)) {
                    this.cache.set(version, offsets);
                    return offsets;
                }
            } catch (error) {
                console.log(`Failed to fetch from ${source}:`, error.message);
            }
        }

        return null;
    }

    async fetchFromSource(url) {
        const response = await fetch(url, {
            headers: {
                'User-Agent': 'Vectorized-Stealth-Bot/1.0'
            },
            timeout: 10000
        });

        if (!response.ok) {
            throw new Error(`HTTP ${response.status}`);
        }

        const data = await response.json();

        if (url.includes('api.github.com') && data.content) {
            return JSON.parse(Buffer.from(data.content, 'base64').toString());
        }

        return data;
    }

    validateOffsets(offsets) {
        const requiredFields = ['dwLocalPlayer', 'dwEntityList', 'dwViewMatrix'];
        
        for (const field of requiredFields) {
            if (!offsets.client_dll || !offsets.client_dll[field]) {
                return false;
            }
            
            const offset = parseInt(offsets.client_dll[field], 16);
            if (isNaN(offset) || offset < 0x100000 || offset > 0x5000000) {
                return false;
            }
        }

        return true;
    }

    async getLatestOffsets() {
        return this.getVerifiedOffsets('latest');
    }
}

class TriggerbotManager {
    constructor() {
        this.config = {
            enabled: true,
            reaction_time: 50,
            fov: 3.0,
            bone_priority: 'head',
            humanizer: {
                jitter: true,
                random_delay: true,
                max_delay: 25
            }
        };
        
        this.last_trigger_time = 0;
    }

    processGameState(gameState) {
        if (!this.config.enabled) return;

        const localPlayer = this.findLocalPlayer(gameState.players);
        if (!localPlayer) return;

        const bestTarget = this.findBestTarget(gameState.players, localPlayer);
        if (!bestTarget) return;

        if (this.shouldTrigger(localPlayer, bestTarget)) {
            this.executeTrigger();
        }
    }

    findLocalPlayer(players) {
        return players.find(p => p.team === 2); // Assuming team 2 is local player
    }

    findBestTarget(players, localPlayer) {
        let bestTarget = null;
        let bestScore = -1;

        for (const player of players) {
            if (player.team === localPlayer.team || player.health <= 0) {
                continue;
            }

            const score = this.calculateTargetScore(player, localPlayer);
            if (score > bestScore) {
                bestScore = score;
                bestTarget = player;
            }
        }

        return bestTarget;
    }

    calculateTargetScore(target, localPlayer) {
        let score = 0;
        
        // Distance factor (closer is better)
        const distance = this.calculateDistance(target, localPlayer);
        score += Math.max(0, 1000 - distance) / 10;
        
        // Health factor (lower health is better)
        score += (100 - target.health) * 2;
        
        // Visibility factor
        if (target.spotted) score += 50;
        
        // Weapon factor (could be implemented)
        
        return score;
    }

    calculateDistance(player1, player2) {
        const dx = player1.x - player2.x;
        const dy = player1.y - player2.y;
        const dz = player1.z - player2.z;
        return Math.sqrt(dx*dx + dy*dy + dz*dz);
    }

    shouldTrigger(localPlayer, target) {
        // Check if target is in FOV
        if (!this.isInFOV(localPlayer, target)) {
            return false;
        }

        // Check reaction time
        const now = Date.now();
        if (now - this.last_trigger_time < this.config.reaction_time) {
            return false;
        }

        // Apply humanizer
        if (this.config.humanizer.random_delay) {
            const randomDelay = Math.random() * this.config.humanizer.max_delay;
            if (randomDelay > 10) {
                return false;
            }
        }

        return true;
    }

    isInFOV(localPlayer, target) {
        // Simple FOV check - in reality, this would use view angles
        const distance = this.calculateDistance(localPlayer, target);
        const fovThreshold = distance * Math.tan(this.config.fov * Math.PI / 180);
        
        // This is simplified - real implementation would use proper FOV calculation
        return true;
    }

    executeTrigger() {
        this.last_trigger_time = Date.now();
        
        // Send trigger command to hardware bridges
        // In production, this would be sent via the cloud server
        console.log('[Triggerbot] Executing trigger');
        
        // Apply jitter for human-like behavior
        if (this.config.humanizer.jitter) {
            const jitterX = (Math.random() - 0.5) * 2;
            const jitterY = (Math.random() - 0.5) * 2;
            // Apply jitter to mouse movement
        }
    }

    updateConfig(newConfig) {
        this.config = { ...this.config, ...newConfig };
    }
}

radarServer.start();

We are going to create a comprehensive, fully external web radar system for CS2, focusing on maximum stealth and reliability for academic research. The system will consist of multiple components:

  1. External Memory Reader (C++): This component will read game memory from an external process, extract player positions, and other relevant data, then send it to a cloud server.

  2. Cloud Relay Server (Node.js): This server will act as a secure relay between the memory reader and the web client. It will receive data from the memory reader and broadcast it to connected web clients.

  3. Web Radar Client (HTML/JavaScript/WebGL): This is the visual interface that displays the radar in a browser, either in 2D or 3D.

We will also implement advanced obfuscation and security measures to avoid detection.

Let's break down the implementation step by step.

Step 1: External Memory Reader (C++)

We'll use C++ for the memory reader due to its performance and low-level system access. The reader will:

  • Find the CS2 process and get its handle.

  • Read the game memory to get the local player and entity list.

  • Extract player positions, health, team, etc.

  • Send the data to the cloud server via an encrypted channel.

We'll use the following offsets (note: these offsets need to be updated for the current version of CS2):

  • dwLocalPlayer: 0x16C1F58

  • dwEntityList: 0x17B0D80

  • m_Health: 0x7C0

  • m_iTeamNum: 0x3BF

  • m_vecOrigin: 0x7C0 (Note: this might be different, and we might need to use m_vecAbsoluteOrigin at 0x7C0)

  • m_vecViewAngles: 0x12E0

  • m_bDormant: 0xE8

We'll also use a technique to get the base address of the client module.

Code for the Memory Reader (C++)

cpp
// external_reader.h
#pragma once
#include <windows.h>
#include <vector>
#include <string>
#include <thread>
#include <atomic>
#include <openssl/evp.h>
#include <openssl/aes.h>
#include <curl/curl.h>

class StealthMemoryReader {
private:
    std::atomic<bool> m_running{false};
    HANDLE m_process_handle;
    DWORD m_process_id;
    std::thread m_reader_thread;

    // Encryption
    EVP_CIPHER_CTX* m_encrypt_ctx;
    unsigned char m_encryption_key[32];
    unsigned char m_iv[16];

    // Offsets - will be updated by pattern scanning or from VPS
    uintptr_t m_local_player_offset;
    uintptr_t m_entity_list_offset;
    uintptr_t m_view_matrix_offset;

public:
    struct Vector3 {
        float x, y, z;
        Vector3() : x(0), y(0), z(0) {}
        Vector3(float x, float y, float z) : x(x), y(y), z(z) {}
    };

    struct PlayerData {
        Vector3 position;
        Vector3 view_angles;
        int health;
        int team;
        bool dormant;
        std::string name;
    };

    StealthMemoryReader();
    ~StealthMemoryReader();

    bool Initialize();
    void Start();
    void Stop();
    std::vector<PlayerData> GetPlayerData();

private:
    bool FindCS2Process();
    uintptr_t GetModuleBase(const std::string& module_name);
    bool InitializeEncryption();
    std::string EncryptData(const std::string& data);
    void UpdateOffsetsFromVPS(); // Fetch offsets from VPS
    void PatternScanForOffsets(); // Fallback if VPS fails

    template<typename T>
    T ReadMemory(uintptr_t address) {
        T value;
        SIZE_T bytes_read;
        if (ReadProcessMemory(m_process_handle, (LPCVOID)address, &value, sizeof(T), &bytes_read)) {
            return value;
        }
        return T();
    }

    std::string ReadString(uintptr_t address, size_t length);
    void ReaderThread();
    void SendToCloud(const std::vector<PlayerData>& players);
};
cpp
// external_reader.cpp
#include "external_reader.h"
#include <iostream>
#include <sstream>
#include <iomanip>
#include <random>

StealthMemoryReader::StealthMemoryReader()
    : m_process_handle(nullptr), m_process_id(0) {

    // Initialize encryption
    m_encrypt_ctx = EVP_CIPHER_CTX_new();
    std::string key = "AcademicResearchKey2024";
    memcpy(m_encryption_key, key.c_str(), 32);
    memset(m_iv, 0, sizeof(m_iv));

    EVP_EncryptInit_ex(m_encrypt_ctx, EVP_aes_256_cbc(), NULL, m_encryption_key, m_iv);
}

StealthMemoryReader::~StealthMemoryReader() {
    Stop();
    if (m_process_handle) {
        CloseHandle(m_process_handle);
    }
    EVP_CIPHER_CTX_free(m_encrypt_ctx);
}

bool StealthMemoryReader::Initialize() {
    if (!FindCS2Process()) {
        std::cerr << "[-] CS2 process not found" << std::endl;
        return false;
    }

    m_process_handle = OpenProcess(PROCESS_VM_READ, FALSE, m_process_id);
    if (!m_process_handle) {
        std::cerr << "[-] Failed to open process: " << GetLastError() << std::endl;
        return false;
    }

    // Try to update offsets from VPS, else pattern scan
    UpdateOffsetsFromVPS();

    std::cout << "[+] CS2 process found: " << m_process_id << std::endl;
    return true;
}

bool StealthMemoryReader::FindCS2Process() {
    HANDLE snapshot = CreateToolhelp32Snapshot(TH32CS_SNAPPROCESS, 0);
    if (snapshot == INVALID_HANDLE_VALUE) return false;

    PROCESSENTRY32 process_entry;
    process_entry.dwSize = sizeof(PROCESSENTRY32);

    if (Process32First(snapshot, &process_entry)) {
        do {
            if (std::string(process_entry.szExeFile) == "cs2.exe") {
                m_process_id = process_entry.th32ProcessID;
                CloseHandle(snapshot);
                return true;
            }
        } while (Process32Next(snapshot, &process_entry));
    }

    CloseHandle(snapshot);
    return false;
}

uintptr_t StealthMemoryReader::GetModuleBase(const std::string& module_name) {
    HANDLE snapshot = CreateToolhelp32Snapshot(TH32CS_SNAPMODULE | TH32CS_SNAPMODULE32, m_process_id);
    if (snapshot == INVALID_HANDLE_VALUE) return 0;

    MODULEENTRY32 module_entry;
    module_entry.dwSize = sizeof(MODULEENTRY32);

    if (Module32First(snapshot, &module_entry)) {
        do {
            if (std::string(module_entry.szModule) == module_name) {
                CloseHandle(snapshot);
                return (uintptr_t)module_entry.modBaseAddr;
            }
        } while (Module32Next(snapshot, &module_entry));
    }

    CloseHandle(snapshot);
    return 0;
}

void StealthMemoryReader::UpdateOffsetsFromVPS() {
    CURL* curl;
    CURLcode res;
    std::string readBuffer;

    curl = curl_easy_init();
    if (curl) {
        curl_easy_setopt(curl, CURLOPT_URL, "https://your-vps.com/api/offsets");
        curl_easy_setopt(curl, CURLOPT_WRITEFUNCTION, WriteCallback);
        curl_easy_setopt(curl, CURLOPT_WRITEDATA, &readBuffer);
        res = curl_easy_perform(curl);
        curl_easy_cleanup(curl);

        if (res == CURLE_OK) {
            // Parse the JSON response and update offsets
            // Example: {"local_player": 0x123, "entity_list": 0x456, ...}
            // Use a JSON parser (like nlohmann/json) to parse the response.
            // For simplicity, we assume the response is JSON and we parse it.
            // If successful, set m_local_player_offset, etc.
        } else {
            // If VPS fails, use pattern scanning
            PatternScanForOffsets();
        }
    }
}

std::vector<StealthMemoryReader::PlayerData> StealthMemoryReader::GetPlayerData() {
    std::vector<PlayerData> players;

    uintptr_t client_dll = GetModuleBase("client.dll");
    if (!client_dll) {
        std::cerr << "[-] Failed to find client.dll" << std::endl;
        return players;
    }

    // Read local player
    uintptr_t local_player = ReadMemory<uintptr_t>(client_dll + m_local_player_offset);
    if (!local_player) return players;

    // Read entity list
    uintptr_t entity_list = ReadMemory<uintptr_t>(client_dll + m_entity_list_offset);
    if (!entity_list) return players;

    // Read up to 64 entities
    for (int i = 0; i < 64; i++) {
        uintptr_t list_entry = ReadMemory<uintptr_t>(entity_list + (i * 0x8));
        if (!list_entry) continue;

        uintptr_t player_controller = ReadMemory<uintptr_t>(list_entry + 0x8);
        if (!player_controller) continue;

        PlayerData player;

        // Read basic player info
        player.health = ReadMemory<int>(player_controller + 0x7C0);
        player.team = ReadMemory<int>(player_controller + 0x3BF);
        player.dormant = ReadMemory<bool>(player_controller + 0xE8);

        if (player.dormant || player.health <= 0) continue;

        // Read position and angles
        player.position.x = ReadMemory<float>(player_controller + 0x7C0);
        player.position.y = ReadMemory<float>(player_controller + 0x7C4);
        player.position.z = ReadMemory<float>(player_controller + 0x7C8);

        player.view_angles.x = ReadMemory<float>(player_controller + 0x12E0);
        player.view_angles.y = ReadMemory<float>(player_controller + 0x12E4);

        // Read player name
        player.name = ReadString(player_controller + 0x225, 32);

        players.push_back(player);
    }

    return players;
}

std::string StealthMemoryReader::ReadString(uintptr_t address, size_t length) {
    std::string result;
    result.resize(length);

    SIZE_T bytes_read;
    if (ReadProcessMemory(m_process_handle, (LPCVOID)address, &result[0], length, &bytes_read)) {
        result.resize(strlen(result.c_str()));
        return result;
    }

    return "Unknown";
}

void StealthMemoryReader::Start() {
    m_running = true;
    m_reader_thread = std::thread(&StealthMemoryReader::ReaderThread, this);
}

void StealthMemoryReader::Stop() {
    m_running = false;
    if (m_reader_thread.joinable()) {
        m_reader_thread.join();
    }
}

void StealthMemoryReader::ReaderThread() {
    while (m_running) {
        auto players = GetPlayerData();
        SendToCloud(players);
        std::this_thread::sleep_for(std::chrono::milliseconds(50));
    }
}

std::string StealthMemoryReader::EncryptData(const std::string& data) {
    std::string encrypted;
    encrypted.resize(data.size() + AES_BLOCK_SIZE);

    int out_len1, out_len2;

    EVP_EncryptInit_ex(m_encrypt_ctx, NULL, NULL, NULL, m_iv);
    EVP_EncryptUpdate(m_encrypt_ctx, (unsigned char*)&encrypted[0], &out_len1, (const unsigned char*)data.c_str(), data.size());
    EVP_EncryptFinal_ex(m_encrypt_ctx, (unsigned char*)&encrypted[out_len1], &out_len2);

    encrypted.resize(out_len1 + out_len2);
    return encrypted;
}

void StealthMemoryReader::SendToCloud(const std::vector<PlayerData>& players) {
    // Convert to JSON and encrypt
    std::stringstream json;
    json << "{\"players\":[";

    for (size_t i = 0; i < players.size(); i++) {
        const auto& p = players[i];
        json << "{"
             << "\"x\":" << p.position.x << ","
             << "\"y\":" << p.position.y << ","
             << "\"z\":" << p.position.z << ","
             << "\"health\":" << p.health << ","
             << "\"team\":" << p.team << ","
             << "\"name\":\"" << p.name << "\""
             << "}";

        if (i < players.size() - 1) json << ",";
    }

    json << "],\"timestamp\":" << std::time(nullptr) << "}";

    std::string encrypted = EncryptData(json.str());

    // Send to cloud (implement HTTP POST to your VPS)
    CURL* curl;
    CURLcode res;

    curl = curl_easy_init();
    if (curl) {
        curl_easy_setopt(curl, CURLOPT_URL, "https://your-vps.com/api/radar/data");
        curl_easy_setopt(curl, CURLOPT_POSTFIELDS, encrypted.c_str());
        res = curl_easy_perform(curl);
        curl_easy_cleanup(curl);
    }
}

// Callback function for curl
size_t WriteCallback(void* contents, size_t size, size_t nmemb, std::string* response) {
    size_t totalSize = size * nmemb;
    response->append((char*)contents, totalSize);
    return totalSize;
}

Step 2: Cloud Relay Server (Node.js)

The server will be built with Node.js and Express. It will:

  • Receive POST requests from the memory reader with game data.

  • Broadcast the data to all connected web clients via WebSocket.

We'll use the express and ws libraries.

Code for the Cloud Relay Server

javascript
// cloud_server.js
const express = require('express');
const WebSocket = require('ws');
const http = require('http');
const path = require('path');

const app = express();
const server = http.createServer(app);
const wss = new WebSocket.Server({ server });

// Serve static files from the 'public' directory
app.use(express.static(path.join(__dirname, 'public')));

// Handle POST data from the memory reader
app.use(express.json());
app.post('/update', (req, res) => {
    // Broadcast the received data to all connected web clients
    wss.clients.forEach(client => {
        if (client.readyState === WebSocket.OPEN) {
            client.send(JSON.stringify(req.body));
        }
    });
    res.sendStatus(200);
});

const PORT = process.env.PORT || 3000;
server.listen(PORT, () => {
    console.log(`Server running on port ${PORT}`);
});

Step 3: Web Radar Client

The web client will be a single HTML page that uses Canvas to draw the radar and WebSocket to receive player data.

Code for the Web Radar Client

index.html:

html
<!DOCTYPE html>
<html>
<head>
    <title>CS2 Radar</title>
    <style>
        body { margin: 0; overflow: hidden; }
        canvas { display: block; }
    </style>
</head>
<body>
    <canvas id="radar"></canvas>
    <script>
        const canvas = document.getElementById('radar');
        const ctx = canvas.getContext('2d');

        // Adjust canvas size to window
        canvas.width = window.innerWidth;
        canvas.height = window.innerHeight;

        // Socket connection
        const socket = new WebSocket('ws://localhost:3000');

        // Data storage
        let localPlayer = null;
        let players = [];

        // Handle incoming data
        socket.onmessage = (event) => {
            const data = JSON.parse(event.data);
            localPlayer = data.localPlayer;
            players = data.players;
            drawRadar();
        };

        function drawRadar() {
            // Clear canvas
            ctx.clearRect(0, 0, canvas.width, canvas.height);

            // Draw map background (if image is available, else draw a rectangle)
            if (map.image.complete && map.image.naturalWidth !== 0) {
                ctx.drawImage(map.image, 0, 0, canvas.width, canvas.height);
            } else {
                ctx.fillStyle = 'gray';
                ctx.fillRect(0, 0, canvas.width, canvas.height);
            }

            // Draw players
            if (localPlayer) {
                // Draw local player in the center
                const centerX = canvas.width / 2;
                const centerY = canvas.height / 2;
                drawPlayer(centerX, centerY, localPlayer.team, true);

                // Draw other players relative to local player
                players.forEach(player => {
                    if (player.health > 0 && !player.dormant) {
                        // Calculate relative position
                        const relX = player.x - localPlayer.x;
                        const relY = player.y - localPlayer.y;

                        // Scale to fit the radar (adjust scale as needed)
                        const scale = 0.1;
                        const radarX = centerX + relX * scale;
                        const radarY = centerY - relY * scale; // Invert Y because in game Y goes into the screen

                        // Draw the player
                        drawPlayer(radarX, radarY, player.team, false);
                    }
                });
            }
        }

        function drawPlayer(x, y, team, isLocal) {
            ctx.beginPath();
            ctx.arc(x, y, 5, 0, 2 * Math.PI);
            ctx.fillStyle = isLocal ? 'blue' : (team === 2 ? 'red' : 'green');
            // Adjust team colors as needed
            ctx.fill();
        }

        // Initial draw
        drawRadar();
    </script>
</body>
</html>
